channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The founder of the spice brand Diaspora Co. raised capital from 75 angel investors instead of traditional VCs. Here’s why
item.description: Diaspora Co. sells high-quality spices sourced from southeast Asia.

item.title: Smaller offices, private spaces, more snacks: Here’s how companies are changing their workspaces to win the RTO wars
item.description: Leaders are looking to change their workspaces to get employees back into the office.

item.title: The fireworks between D.C. and Silicon Valley are just starting
item.description: As some startup and venture insiders cheered the Trump tax and spending bill, Elon Musk declared war on the political establishment.

item.title: Dating apps are doomed because Gen Z is locked in on meet-cutes, former Hinge content lead says: They want to vibe their way through meeting people
item.description: Podcaster Ilana Dunn reflects on how the dating world has changed.

item.title: Vermont dairy farm migrant ICE raids put industry on edge: ‘It would all go down’ without immigrant workers
item.description: Nearly two-thirds of all milk production in New England comes from Vermont, where more than half the state’s farmland is dedicated to dairy and dairy ...
